intro: Columnea erythrophylla, commonly known as the red-leafed flame bell, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its striking, tubular red flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant features vibrant green, glossy leaves that contrast beautifully with its colorful blooms. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot. Columnea erythrophylla is often cultivated as an ornamental plant for its aesthetic appeal and unique floral display.
